meanings.defination: Điều không may ban đầu nhưng lại mang đến điều tốt về sau.
example: Losing that job turned out to be a blessing in disguise as I found a better one.

meanings.defination: Chỉ một phần rất nhỏ so với tổng thể.
example: The money raised for charity was just a drop in the bucket compared to what was needed.

meanings.defination: Hành động có giá trị hơn lời nói suông.
example: He keeps promising to change, but actions speak louder than words.

meanings.defination: Làm tình hình xấu đi hoặc căng thẳng hơn.
example: Don’t mention the mistake again – it’ll just add fuel to the fire.

meanings.defination: Chỉ giỏi đe dọa chứ không thực hiện, chỉ mạnh miệng.
example: He threatens to sue, but he’s all bark and no bite.

meanings.defination: Chăm chú lắng nghe.
example: Tell me about your trip! I’m all ears.

name: The ball is in your court

meanings.defination: Tới lượt bạn quyết định hoặc hành động.
example: I’ve done my part; the ball is in your court now.

meanings.defination: Nhầm lẫn hoặc hiểu sai vấn đề.
example: If you think I took your wallet, you’re barking up the wrong tree.

meanings.defination: Rất dễ dàng, đơn giản.
example: Fixing this error was a piece of cake for the experienced programmer.

meanings.defination: Nói vòng vo, không đi thẳng vào vấn đề.
example: Stop beating around the bush and tell me what you really think.

meanings.defination: Nỗ lực rất nhiều để giúp ai đó.
example: They bent over backwards to make their guests feel welcome.

name: Between a rock and a hard place

meanings.defination: Rơi vào tình huống khó khăn, tiến thoái lưỡng nan.
example: She was between a rock and a hard place; she could neither quit nor continue the job happily.

name: Bite off more than you can chew

meanings.defination: Cố gắng làm việc vượt quá khả năng.
example: He bit off more than he could chew by taking on six classes this semester.

meanings.defination: Can đảm chịu đựng hoặc đối mặt với khó khăn.
example: I decided to bite the bullet and pay for the expensive repair.

meanings.defination: Chúc may mắn (thường dùng trong nghệ thuật biểu diễn).
example: You have a big performance tonight? Well, break a leg!

meanings.defination: Thức khuya để làm việc hoặc học hành.
example: I had to burn the midnight oil to finish the project on time.

meanings.defination: Cảm giác bồn chồn, lo lắng.
example: I always get butterflies in my stomach before a presentation.

meanings.defination: Quyết định dừng làm việc (trong ngày hoặc dự án).
example: We’ve been working for hours. Let’s call it a day and go home.

name: Can't judge a book by its cover

meanings.defination: Không nên đánh giá ai/cái gì qua vẻ bề ngoài.
example: He looks shy, but you can’t judge a book by its cover.

meanings.defination: Làm ai đó bất ngờ, không kịp phản ứng.
example: Her sudden question caught me off guard.

name: Cost an arm and a leg

meanings.defination: Rất đắt đỏ.
example: That designer handbag cost her an arm and a leg.

meanings.defination: Làm việc một cách cẩu thả để tiết kiệm thời gian/tiền bạc.
example: When building a house, don’t cut corners on materials.

meanings.defination: Nương tay, bớt khắt khe với ai đó.
example: She’s still new to the job, so cut her some slack.

meanings.defination: Người hay nêu quan điểm trái ngược để tranh luận.
example: I’ll play devil’s advocate and argue the other side.

name: Don't count your chickens before they hatch

meanings.defination: Đừng tính trước điều gì khi chưa chắc chắn.
example: They promised me a bonus, but I won’t count my chickens before they hatch.

name: Don't put all your eggs in one basket

meanings.defination: Đừng dồn mọi thứ vào cùng một nơi hoặc dự án.
example: Invest in different markets; don’t put all your eggs in one basket.

meanings.defination: Sát nút, gần hết thời gian.
example: They finished the test just down to the wire.

meanings.defination: Đặt ra giới hạn, không chấp nhận vượt quá.
example: I draw the line at lying to customers.

meanings.defination: Làm ai đó vô cùng khó chịu, phát điên.
example: His constant whistling drives me up the wall.

meanings.defination: Vấn đề lớn ai cũng biết nhưng né tránh nói đến.
example: The fact that he’s broke is the elephant in the room during their family meetings.

name: Every cloud has a silver lining

meanings.defination: Trong cái rủi có cái may.
example: I know you’re upset about losing the job, but every cloud has a silver lining.

meanings.defination: Chán ngấy, không chịu được nữa.
example: I’m fed up with the noise in this neighborhood.

name: Finding a needle in a haystack

meanings.defination: Tìm kim đáy bể, gần như không thể tìm được.
example: Finding my ring on the beach was like finding a needle in a haystack.

meanings.defination: Cảm giác lạc lõng, không thoải mái trong môi trường mới.
example: I felt like a fish out of water at that formal event.

name: Get a taste of your own medicine

meanings.defination: Bị đối xử theo cách mình đối xử với người khác (thường là xấu).
example: He’s always late, so when we left without him, he got a taste of his own medicine.

meanings.defination: Vượt quá tầm kiểm soát.
example: The party started to get out of hand when more people arrived than expected.

meanings.defination: Trút bầu tâm sự, nói ra điều đang lo nghĩ.
example: I had to get it off my chest and tell him how I felt.

meanings.defination: Làm lơ, đối xử lạnh nhạt với ai đó.
example: She gave me the cold shoulder after our argument.

meanings.defination: Thất bại thảm hại và đột ngột.
example: His plan to start a restaurant went down in flames after just six months.

meanings.defination: Cố gắng hơn mức bình thường để đạt mục tiêu.
example: He always goes the extra mile to help his customers.

meanings.defination: Đi ngủ.
example: I’m exhausted. I’m going to hit the sack.

name: Hit the nail on the head

meanings.defination: Nói hoặc làm chính xác.
example: You hit the nail on the head with your analysis.

meanings.defination: Bắt đầu học tập chăm chỉ.
example: I need to hit the books if I want to pass tomorrow’s exam.

meanings.defination: Bình tĩnh, đừng nóng vội.
example: Hold your horses! We still have time before the deadline.

meanings.defination: Gặp rắc rối hoặc tình thế khó khăn.
example: He found himself in hot water after missing the deadline again.

name: In the heat of the moment

meanings.defination: Trong lúc tức giận hoặc căng thẳng mà hành động thiếu suy nghĩ.
example: He said some harsh words in the heat of the moment.

meanings.defination: Cùng chung hoàn cảnh, thường là khó khăn.
example: We’re all in the same boat; we need to work together.

meanings.defination: Không quá phức tạp hay khó hiểu.
example: Just follow the instructions; it’s not rocket science.

meanings.defination: Chạy theo trào lưu hay xu hướng đang thịnh hành.
example: He jumped on the bandwagon and started investing in tech stocks.

meanings.defination: Để mắt, trông chừng.
example: Can you keep an eye on my bag while I go to the restroom?

meanings.defination: Giữ vững tinh thần, lạc quan.
example: Keep your chin up, things will get better soon.

name: Kill two birds with one stone

meanings.defination: Một mũi tên trúng hai đích.
example: By shopping on the way home, I killed two birds with one stone.

meanings.defination: Tìm kiếm, kiểm tra cẩn thận mọi khả năng.
example: We’ll leave no stone unturned in our search for the missing puppy.

name: Let the cat out of the bag

meanings.defination: Tiết lộ bí mật (thường là vô ý).
example: He accidentally let the cat out of the bag about the surprise party.

meanings.defination: Cân nhắc kỹ trước khi hành động.
example: You should look before you leap when changing jobs.

meanings.defination: Mất đi kỹ năng hoặc khả năng vốn có.
example: I used to be good at basketball, but I’ve lost my touch.

meanings.defination: Tóm tắt ngắn gọn, đi vào ý chính.
example: To make a long story short, we missed the flight and had to drive.

meanings.defination: Lỡ cơ hội.
example: He missed the boat by not applying for the job in time.

meanings.defination: Không thể hành động hay giúp đỡ do hoàn cảnh.
example: I’d love to help, but my hands are tied by the rules.

meanings.defination: Có làm thì mới có hưởng, phải chịu khó mới thành công.
example: He works out every day because he believes in ‘no pain, no gain.’

name: Not playing with a full deck

meanings.defination: Không bình thường hoặc không thông minh lắm.
example: Sometimes I think he’s not playing with a full deck.

name: Off the top of my head

meanings.defination: Nói hoặc nghĩ ngay lập tức, không chuẩn bị trước.
example: Off the top of my head, I can’t recall his phone number.

meanings.defination: Nhanh nhẹn, hiểu vấn đề nhanh và làm tốt.
example: She’s really on the ball when it comes to organizing events.

meanings.defination: Hiếm khi xảy ra.
example: I only go to the cinema once in a blue moon.

meanings.defination: Xuất hiện một cách bất ngờ, không báo trước.
example: A car came out of nowhere and nearly hit me.

meanings.defination: Hoàn toàn bất ngờ, đột ngột.
example: He called me out of the blue after years of no contact.

meanings.defination: Rất vui sướng, hạnh phúc tột độ.
example: She was over the moon when she got the job offer.

meanings.defination: Trêu chọc ai đó, thường theo kiểu đùa giỡn.
example: I’m just pulling your leg; of course I trust you.

meanings.defination: Bình tĩnh lại, điều chỉnh cảm xúc hoặc hành vi.
example: After failing the exam, he had to pull himself together and start studying again.

meanings.defination: Tạm hoãn hoặc dừng kế hoạch.
example: We decided to put the project on ice until we have more funding.

meanings.defination: Phá hỏng niềm vui hoặc kế hoạch của ai đó.
example: I don’t want to rain on your parade, but our flight just got canceled.

meanings.defination: Hiểu ẩn ý, hiểu sâu xa hơn lời nói hay văn bản.
example: Try to read between the lines when you review the contract.

meanings.defination: Mưa xối xả, mưa tầm tã.
example: Take an umbrella; it’s raining cats and dogs out there.

meanings.defination: Đồng quan điểm, nhất trí với nhau.
example: My boss and I don’t always see eye to eye on things.

meanings.defination: Kiên nhẫn chờ đợi mà không hành động hấp tấp.
example: Just sit tight, and I’ll bring you the news as soon as possible.

meanings.defination: Bí mật xấu hổ không muốn ai biết.
example: Everyone has a skeleton in their closet they’d rather keep hidden.

meanings.defination: Hành động mạo hiểm, gần nguy hiểm.
example: He’s skating on thin ice by lying to his boss.

meanings.defination: Tiết lộ bí mật (thường vô ý).
example: He spilled the beans about the surprise party.

meanings.defination: Vừa nhắc Tào Tháo, Tào Tháo đến.
example: Speak of the devil, here comes Tom.

meanings.defination: Nói thẳng ra điều muốn nói.
example: If you have something to say, just spit it out.

meanings.defination: Ôm đồm quá nhiều việc dẫn đến không làm tốt được.
example: She’s spreading herself too thin by taking on another project.

meanings.defination: Phản bội, chơi xấu sau lưng ai đó.
example: He stabbed his partner in the back by selling the secret formula.

meanings.defination: Giữ vững lập trường, không lùi bước.
example: Even if they disagree, stand your ground if you believe in your idea.

meanings.defination: Lấy mất sự chú ý hay công lao của người khác.
example: They announced their wedding at my party and stole my thunder.

meanings.defination: Giữ vững quan điểm bất chấp phản đối.
example: He stuck to his guns even though everyone else disagreed.

meanings.defination: Thông tin trực tiếp từ nguồn tin cậy nhất.
example: I heard it straight from the horse’s mouth that she’s moving to Italy.

name: Take it with a grain of salt

meanings.defination: Đừng quá tin hoàn toàn, hãy nghi ngờ.
example: He exaggerates, so take his stories with a grain of salt.

name: Take the bull by the horns

meanings.defination: Dám đương đầu trực tiếp với vấn đề.
example: She decided to take the bull by the horns and address the issue.

meanings.defination: Hoàn cảnh kết hợp hai điều kiện tốt nhất.
example: Living near the city but in a quiet area gives us the best of both worlds.

name: The early bird catches the worm

meanings.defination: Ai đến sớm (hoặc chủ động) sẽ được lợi.
example: We need to get to the store early. The early bird catches the worm.

meanings.defination: Giọt nước tràn ly, điều cuối cùng vượt sức chịu đựng.
example: Losing his job was the last straw; he decided to move away.

meanings.defination: Chỉ là phần nổi của vấn đề, còn nhiều thứ ẩn sâu.
example: The reported crimes are just the tip of the iceberg.

meanings.defination: Bỏ cuộc, chấp nhận thất bại.
example: After months of struggling, he decided to throw in the towel.

meanings.defination: Kết hôn.
example: They decided to tie the knot in a small ceremony.

meanings.defination: Thời gian trôi nhanh.
example: Time flies when you’re having fun.

meanings.defination: Quá tốt nên khó mà tin được.
example: The offer seemed too good to be true, so I was cautious.

meanings.defination: Cảm thấy ốm hoặc không khỏe.
example: I’ve been feeling under the weather all day.

meanings.defination: Chưa chắc chắn, chưa được quyết định.
example: Our vacation plans are still up in the air.

name: Variety is the spice of life

meanings.defination: Sự đa dạng làm cuộc sống thêm thú vị.
example: She tries different cuisines because variety is the spice of life.

name: We'll cross that bridge when we come to it

meanings.defination: Đến đâu hay đến đó, gặp vấn đề mới tính.
example: I’m not worried about the rent increase yet; we’ll cross that bridge when we come to it.

meanings.defination: Điều không thể xảy ra.
example: He’ll clean his room when pigs fly.

meanings.defination: Hiểu được điều gì phức tạp.
example: I’m still trying to wrap my head around this new concept.

name: You can't have your cake and eat it too

meanings.defination: Không thể vừa được cái này vừa được cái kia (mâu thuẫn).
example: He wants more free time but also wants a higher salary; you can’t have your cake and eat it too.

name: You can lead a horse to water, but you can't make him drink

meanings.defination: Bạn có thể cho ai đó cơ hội nhưng không thể buộc họ nắm lấy.
example: I gave her the information, but she won’t act on it. You can lead a horse to water, but you can’t make him drink.

meanings.defination: Dùng để hỏi ai đó đang suy nghĩ gì.
example: You’ve been quiet today – a penny for your thoughts?

meanings.defination: Xát muối vào vết thương, làm tình hình tệ hơn.
example: He arrived late and then, to add insult to injury, he forgot the tickets.

meanings.defination: Quay về điểm xuất phát.
example: We lost the data and now we’re back to square one.

meanings.defination: Phá hủy mối quan hệ, không thể quay lại.
example: Don’t burn bridges with your former employer.

meanings.defination: Gặp rắc rối, chịu hậu quả vì hành động của mình.
example: He burned his fingers in that risky investment.

meanings.defination: Bị bắt quả tang đang làm gì xấu.
example: He was caught red-handed stealing money from the till.

meanings.defination: Gần đạt được mục tiêu nhưng vẫn thất bại.
example: Her score was close but no cigar to win the contest.

meanings.defination: Đi thẳng vào vấn đề chính, không vòng vo.
example: Let’s cut to the chase: do you want this job or not?

meanings.defination: Đừng lãng phí thời gian vào việc vô ích, đã kết thúc.
example: Stop talking about it; you’re just beating a dead horse.

meanings.defination: Thừa nhận mình sai và rút lại lời nói.
example: He had to eat his words after the product became a success.

meanings.defination: Ai rồi cũng có lúc thành công hoặc cơ hội.
example: Don’t give up – every dog has its day.

meanings.defination: Thử làm việc gì.
example: I’ve never tried dancing before, but I’ll give it a shot.

name: Go back to the drawing board

meanings.defination: Quay lại từ đầu để làm lại kế hoạch.
example: The design didn’t work, so we went back to the drawing board.

meanings.defination: Đổ sông đổ biển, lãng phí hoàn toàn.
example: All our efforts went down the drain when the deal was canceled.

meanings.defination: Tan thành mây khói, không thành công.
example: His dream of becoming a singer went up in smoke after the accident.

meanings.defination: Thích ăn đồ ngọt.
example: I have a sweet tooth, so I love desserts.

meanings.defination: Lo lắng, bồn chồn (thường trước sự kiện quan trọng).
example: She had butterflies in her stomach before her performance.

meanings.defination: Yêu say đắm, hoàn toàn bị cuốn hút.
example: He’s head over heels in love with his new girlfriend.

meanings.defination: Cực kỳ lo lắng, sợ hãi.
example: My heart was in my mouth when I heard the loud bang.

meanings.defination: Bắt đầu việc gì với tinh thần sẵn sàng và nhiệt huyết.
example: He hit the ground running on his first day at the new job.

meanings.defination: Trúng lớn, thành công bất ngờ.
example: She hit the jackpot with her new online business.

meanings.defination: Giữ im lặng, không nói ra điều có thể gây rắc rối.
example: You’d better hold your tongue rather than start an argument.

meanings.defination: Chuyện gì cũng cần hai phía chịu trách nhiệm.
example: We can’t blame just one side; it takes two to tango.

meanings.defination: Vội vàng kết luận mà chưa có đủ thông tin.
example: Don’t jump to conclusions without hearing both sides.

meanings.defination: Giữ cho điều gì không xảy ra hoặc không đến gần.
example: We need strong measures to keep the disease at bay.

meanings.defination: Chết (tiếng lóng).
example: The old man finally kicked the bucket at age 95.

meanings.defination: Đề ra quy định nghiêm khắc, yêu cầu tuân thủ.
example: He laid down the law: no phones at the dinner table.

meanings.defination: Đừng khơi lại chuyện cũ gây rắc rối.
example: I decided not to mention the argument and let sleeping dogs lie.

meanings.defination: Kiếm đủ tiền để trang trải cuộc sống.
example: They struggle to make ends meet on a single income.

meanings.defination: Vô cùng hạnh phúc.
example: He’s been on cloud nine since he got the promotion.

meanings.defination: Đang trong tình huống mạo hiểm hoặc nguy hiểm.
example: You’re on thin ice if you keep coming to work late.

meanings.defination: Sợ mắc sai lầm vì đã trải qua trước đó.
example: She won’t invest in stocks again. Once bitten, twice shy.

meanings.defination: Cố ý tranh luận ngược lại để kiểm chứng ý kiến.
example: I’ll play devil’s advocate so we can cover all angles.

meanings.defination: Càng luyện tập càng thành thạo.
example: Keep practicing; practice makes perfect.

meanings.defination: Dồn hết sức lực, không tiếc công sức.
example: They pulled out all the stops for their daughter’s wedding.

name: Put your money where your mouth is

meanings.defination: Hành động thay vì chỉ nói suông.
example: If you think it’ll work, then invest. Put your money where your mouth is.

meanings.defination: Vắt óc suy nghĩ.
example: I’ve been racking my brain all day trying to remember her name.

meanings.defination: Tiết kiệm cho lúc khó khăn.
example: You should save for a rainy day in case you lose your job.

meanings.defination: Giúp ai với mong muốn họ giúp lại mình.
example: I’ll scratch your back if you scratch mine.

meanings.defination: Nhìn toàn cảnh, hiểu hết mọi khía cạnh.
example: Try to see the big picture instead of focusing on minor details.

meanings.defination: Bộc lộ bản chất thật.
example: He finally showed his true colors when he started yelling at everyone.

meanings.defination: Nghĩ thêm (thường qua đêm) trước khi quyết định.
example: Don’t rush; sleep on it and tell me tomorrow.

meanings.defination: Nghi ngờ có gì đó bất chính.
example: I smell a rat in this deal; it’s too good to be true.

meanings.defination: Bận ngập đầu.
example: I can’t go out this weekend; I’m snowed under with work.

meanings.defination: Nói thẳng suy nghĩ, quan điểm.
example: Don’t be afraid to speak your mind at the meeting.

meanings.defination: Liều mình, chấp nhận rủi ro để giúp ai hoặc nêu ý kiến.
example: He stuck his neck out to defend his friend at work.

meanings.defination: Đừng vòng vo nữa, hãy nói thẳng.
example: Stop beating around the bush and say what you want.

name: Strike while the iron is hot

meanings.defination: Nắm lấy cơ hội ngay khi còn nóng, còn thuận lợi.
example: He decided to strike while the iron is hot and propose the plan now.

meanings.defination: Hẹn lần sau (từ chối khéo nhưng còn ý muốn gặp lại).
example: I’m busy tonight, can I take a rain check on that dinner?

meanings.defination: Bình tĩnh, thư giãn, không căng thẳng.
example: You’ve been working too hard. Take it easy this weekend.

meanings.defination: Nói về điều tệ nhất hoặc ấn tượng nhất (mỉa mai).
example: I’ve seen bad presentations, but that one really takes the cake.

meanings.defination: Nghe quen thuộc, gợi nhớ.
example: Her name rings a bell, but I can’t remember where we met.

name: The best thing since sliced bread

meanings.defination: Ý tưởng hoặc phát minh tuyệt vời nhất.
example: Online shopping is the best thing since sliced bread!

meanings.defination: Cùng nhau vượt mọi gian nan, khó khăn.
example: They stayed friends through thick and thin.

meanings.defination: Bắt đầu thay đổi cách sống hoặc làm việc tốt hơn.
example: He promised to turn over a new leaf and quit smoking.

meanings.defination: Bị kiểm soát hoặc ảnh hưởng bởi ai đó.
example: He has her under his thumb because he pays her bills.

meanings.defination: Làm điều gì bí mật, thường là bất hợp pháp.
example: They paid him under the table to avoid taxes.

name: Walk a mile in someone's shoes

meanings.defination: Đặt mình vào hoàn cảnh của người khác để thấu hiểu.
example: Try to walk a mile in his shoes before judging his actions.

meanings.defination: Phủi bỏ trách nhiệm, không liên quan.
example: He washed his hands of the project after the conflict started.

meanings.defination: Chuyện đã qua, không nên nhắc lại.
example: We had our disagreements, but that’s water under the bridge now.

meanings.defination: Theo đuổi điều vô ích, không có kết quả.
example: Searching for the old document was a wild goose chase.

meanings.defination: Ăn gì sẽ ảnh hưởng đến sức khỏe, phản ánh con người bạn.
example: Try to eat healthy; you are what you eat.

meanings.defination: Giữ im lặng, đừng nói ra.
example: Zip your lip about the surprise gift.

meanings.defination: Chuyện bé xé ra to.
example: Don’t worry about their argument; it’s just a storm in a teacup.

meanings.defination: Cùng chung hoàn cảnh.
example: We’re all in the same boat with these budget cuts.

name: At the drop of a hat

meanings.defination: Ngay lập tức, không chần chừ.
example: He’s ready to travel at the drop of a hat.

meanings.defination: Con số ước chừng, không chính xác tuyệt đối.
example: Can you give me a ballpark figure on the cost?

meanings.defination: Nói mãi nhưng chẳng thay đổi gì, vô ích.
example: You can argue until you’re blue in the face, but he won’t listen.

name: By the skin of your teeth

meanings.defination: Suýt soát, vừa kịp.
example: He passed the exam by the skin of his teeth.

meanings.defination: Từ chối nói hoặc đột ngột im lặng.
example: He clammed up when the police started asking questions.

meanings.defination: Cầu mong điều tốt đẹp sẽ xảy ra.
example: I have a job interview today – cross your fingers for me.

meanings.defination: Đáp ứng được tiêu chuẩn, kỳ vọng.
example: We hired him, but he just couldn’t cut the mustard.

meanings.defination: Buồn bã, chán nản.
example: He’s been down in the dumps since he lost his job.

meanings.defination: Đối mặt với hậu quả của hành động.
example: He broke the rules, so now he must face the music.

meanings.defination: Cảm thấy không khỏe.
example: I’m feeling under the weather, so I’ll stay home today.

meanings.defination: Chi tiền (thường miễn cưỡng).
example: We had to fork out a lot of money for car repairs.

meanings.defination: Lo lắng, sợ hãi trước một sự kiện quan trọng.
example: He got cold feet before the wedding.

meanings.defination: Trở nên phấn khích hoặc giận dữ tột độ.
example: The crowd went bananas when the band came on stage.

meanings.defination: Rất tức giận, nổi giận đùng đùng.
example: My dad hit the roof when I crashed his car.

meanings.defination: Gặp rắc rối, hoàn cảnh khó khăn.
example: We’re in a pickle with these overdue bills.

name: In the blink of an eye

meanings.defination: Xảy ra rất nhanh, chớp mắt.
example: The car disappeared in the blink of an eye.

meanings.defination: Về lâu dài, xét về tương lai xa.
example: It might be expensive now, but it’ll pay off in the long run.

meanings.defination: Chú ý quan sát cẩn thận.
example: Keep your eyes peeled for any suspicious activity.

meanings.defination: Nói để tránh xui xẻo sau khi đề cập đến điều tốt.
example: I’ve never broken a bone, knock on wood.

meanings.defination: Mất tỉnh táo hoặc hành xử điên rồ.
example: She started yelling at everyone; I think she’s losing her marbles.

meanings.defination: Gây chú ý, tạo xáo trộn hoặc tranh cãi.
example: He made waves with his controversial opinion in the meeting.

meanings.defination: Chuyện rối rắm, khó hiểu hoặc vô nghĩa.
example: That explanation was just mumbo jumbo to me.

meanings.defination: Quyết định dễ dàng, không cần suy nghĩ nhiều.
example: Accepting that job offer was a no-brainer.

meanings.defination: Tùy cơ ứng biến, không có kế hoạch cố định.
example: I’m not sure what time we’ll leave; let’s just play it by ear.

meanings.defination: Nghe quen quen, gợi nhớ điều gì.
example: Does the name Alex ring a bell?

meanings.defination: Mất hứng, hết năng lượng hoặc động lực.
example: He worked so hard that he ran out of steam by the afternoon.

meanings.defination: Rời đi một cách giận dữ, ầm ầm.
example: She stormed out of the room after the argument.

meanings.defination: Quyết định làm điều mạo hiểm hoặc quan trọng sau khi suy nghĩ.
example: They took the plunge and got married after dating for a month.

meanings.defination: Đối xử với ai đó theo cách họ đối xử với người khác (thường là tệ).
example: He’s always criticizing others, so when he got scolded, it was a taste of his own medicine.

meanings.defination: Ngay trước mắt mà không nhận ra.
example: I searched everywhere for my keys, and they were right under my nose the whole time.

meanings.defination: Bất chấp rủi ro, liều lĩnh.
example: She threw caution to the wind and quit her job to travel.

meanings.defination: Tiết kiệm, chi tiêu chặt chẽ hơn.
example: We need to tighten our belt until the next paycheck.
